Description: Terracotta figure base fragment of foot only. Mould-made. White coating with red paint preserved on some areas. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

NA453 and NA447 are very similar to GR1888,0601.126, a Greek import also found in Naukratis dated to the 3rd century BC and also an example from Cyrenaica dated c.300BC. (Burn & Higgins 2001, no.2722).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.376) (Phase 1)
